me.utk.networking

Interface ClientImplementation


  • public interface ClientImplementation
    The framework for any client implementation in this API.

    Any ClientImplementations must implement the following methods:

    • sendMessages(String...) sends the specified messages to the server
    • getMessageBuilder() returns the MessageBuilder corresponding to this connection
    • setConnectionTimeout(int) sets the timeout duration of this client
    • connect(String, int) )} tries to connect this client to the specified network address
    • connect(String, int, String) tries to connect this client to the specified network address
    Version:
    December 8, 2020
    Author:
    Utkarsh Priyam
    See Also:
    MessageBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • sendMessages

        void sendMessages(String... messages)
        Sends the given messages to the server using implementation-specific messaging protocols.

        The sent messages are guaranteed to be received in exactly the same order as they were sent, unless specified otherwise in documentation.

        Parameters:
        messages - String messages to send to client
        See Also:
        MessageBuilder.nextMessage()

      • getMessageBuilder

        MessageBuilder getMessageBuilder()
        Returns the MessageBuilder associated with this client.

        This MessageBuilder is responsible for collecting and coalescing received message fragments sent by the server into a complete message that can then be used by this client.

        Returns:
        The MessageBuilder associated with this client
        See Also:
        MessageBuilder

      • setConnectionTimeout

        void setConnectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the amount of time to wait for server connection before timing out.

        A non-positive input signifies the implementation-specific default timeout duration.

        Parameters:
        timeout - Number of milliseconds until timeout

      • connect

        boolean connect(String address,
                int port)
        Attempts to connect to the specified network address without a passcode.
        Parameters:
        address - The IP address to connect to
        port - The network port to connect to
        Returns:
        true if the connection was accepted by the server; otherwise, false

      • connect

        boolean connect(String address,
                int port,
                String passcode)
        Attempts to connect to the specified network address with the specified passcode.
        Parameters:
        address - The IP address to connect to
        port - The network port to connect to
        passcode - The passcode to use to connect
        Returns:
        true if the connection was accepted by the server; otherwise, false

      • closeClient

        void closeClient()
        Closes all threads and resolves all objects in use by this client.

        This utility method provides a way of closing threads and resolving any objects in use by this client that could become orphaned when the client is closed.

        Any users should note that failing to call this method prior to destroying a client (via Java's Garbage Collection) can result in a build-up of inaccessible runaway threads which can consume processing power and even leave the Java Runtime Environment unable to close.
